devanagari:
दिवि: सर्गोऽयं सृष्टिं च प्राकृत्याऽविमोक्ष्यति।
उद्भवोऽयं च सृष्टिं च प्राकृत्याऽविमोक्ष्यति॥ १३॥
transliteration:
diviḥ sargo 'yaṁ sṛṣṭiṁ ca
prākṛtyā 'vimokṣyati
udbhavo 'yaṁ ca sṛṣṭiṁ ca
prākṛtyā 'vimokṣyati
translation: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction. O son of Kunti, the wise who know this engage in My devotional service.
purport: In this verse, the Lord explains the relationship between His divine energy and the material nature. He emphasizes that material nature operates under His direction. The phrase 'prākṛtyā 'vimokṣyati' indicates that those who understand this truth can transcend the influence of material nature and attain liberation. The wise, referred to as 'buddhāḥ,' recognize the Supreme Lord as the ultimate controller of all energies and thus engage in devotional service. This understanding leads to a deeper appreciation of the Lord's position and fosters a sincere desire to serve Him. Ultimately, this verse encourages individuals to see beyond the material world and recognize the divine hand guiding all creation.
